title: torch.save() and nn.DataParallel()
body_html:
As pointed out in this post, when model is trained using DataParallel(), the saved model state_dict will have prefix "module." before the names of all layers.

Is there a reason for such a prefix? Why couldn't this prefix be removed?
body_text:
As pointed out in this post, when model is trained using DataParallel(), the saved model state_dict will have prefix "module." before the names of all layers.
Is there a reason for such a prefix? Why couldn't this prefix be removed?
body:
As pointed out in this [post](https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/solved-keyerror-unexpected-key-module-encoder-embedding-weight-in-state-dict/1686), when model is trained using DataParallel(), the saved model state_dict will have prefix "module." before the names of all layers. 

Is there a reason for such a prefix? Why couldn't this prefix be removed?
